intro: Stachys riederi var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate wood betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, tubular, and clustered in whorls, often displaying shades of purple or blue. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
